newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian Stocks to Watch Today - Feb 24.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian Stocks to Watch Today - Feb 24.

text.p: Some Australian stocks to watch this morning:
The company announced a net loss of A$16.8 million on joint venture basis compared with profit of A$232.3 million a year earlier after recording gross abnormal loss of A$115.0 million.
Newspapers report police are expected to announce later on Monday that the extortion scare is over, a week after the extortionist failed to repeat his threat by Monday.
Biotechnology company said on Monday that phase three clinical trials for its anti-influenza drug, zanamivir, or GG167, would begin in Australia in May.

Brierley Investments Ltd said on Friday it would raise its stake in John Fairfax Holdings Ltd to 25 percent using the "creep" provisions in Australia's Corporations Law. Earlier on Friday, Fairfax shareholders voted, on a count of proxies, against a proposal by Brierley to increase its stake in the publisher by five percent to 25 percent.

There are rumours that Coles Myer's largest shareholder, Solomon Lew, was behind the turnover of more than 1.3 million Country Road shares late last week, the Australian Financial Review newspaper reported on Monday.
